Q: Can science prove that black magic does not exist? A2A A: No, and it doesn’t have to. Science investigates evidence, people who believe in magic don’t have any evidence, so science does not concern itself with their claims. A more pertinent question would be: Can you prove that magic is real? Of course you can’t, hence the reason you’re asking for disproof of your superstitious nonsense, to shift your burden of proof onto unbelievers, standard practice amongst those who don’t know the difference between claims and evidence. What you have is a claim, what you do not have is evidence. Learn what evidence is, present some, then we can have a reasonable discussion.

Science does not try to prove the non-existence of things that don’t exist. After all, there are an infinity of things that don’t exist. Where would you start? If you think something exists and wish to convince others that it exists, you need to provide clear, irrefutable, evidence that is sufficiently detailed to allow for scientific testing of your premise. Rational belief is not something we can choose to believe. It must be discovered from clear evidence that can be validated by the Scientific Method. Any other belief is irrational, and almost certainly false.

“Proof” and “existence” in science, and the philosophy of science that underlies science now, do not have the same meaning thrown about by people when discussing the supernatural. Science does not concern itself with the supernatural. At all. Science only examines and uses natural explanation of natural phenomena. Now if supernatural claimants contend that something in the natural world can be controlled or demonstrated in some other fashion, some of its claims can be examined. So if you claim that you can control magic and cause something to occur in the natural world, we can test that claim in the same way that ESP claims are tested, requesting you demonstrate your ability. So in that way such claims can indeed be debunked. Science does not examine the existence of the supernatural in an abstract way, only contentions that the supernatural has repeatable effects on the natural world that humans can demonstrate.
